g.text: prices in almost full hotel or
last few seats in a plane cost more
micro-services pattern is a design choice
here vs monolithic architecture. Micro services
can be maintained by different teams and scaled
independently, monolith can make DB transactions easier
shard can hold data for several hotels
with good number queries and transactions per second
MySQL reaches maximum efficiency for 128 user threads,
with its max TPS (1.8 million) and low latency (70 microseconds)
in addition to hotel info also handle
contacts (or be in its own guest service)
In microservice setup inventory may be handled by different service and DB,
than reservations DB, in this case you might need transactions in different systems
